title: Celtics bench shines in bounce-back win over Magic: 7 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: The Celtics won 111-107 against the Orlando Magic, claiming a split in their two-game series in Orlando.
Luka Garza led the Celtics' bench with 16 points, 14 in the second half, and finished with a +9 performance.
Jordan Walsh impressed defensively and hit a crucial late-game 3-pointer, contributing to the Celtics' close victory.

title: Jason Varitek is happy to be back with Red Sox on a new deal
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jason Varitek signed a new contract to remain with the Boston Red Sox as game-planning and run prevention coach.
Varitek, a former catcher, expressed loyalty to the Red Sox despite considering managerial roles elsewhere.
Varitek praised rookie catcher Carlos Narvaez’s first full MLB season, highlighting his defensive skills and team presence.

title: Patriots’ explosive rookie class breaks through at perfect time in Tampa
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Rookies Kyle Williams and TreVeyon Henderson scored three touchdowns, contributing significantly to the Patriots' 28-23 win over the Buccaneers.
Williams achieved a top speed of 21.78 mph with a 71-yard reception, while Henderson hit 22.01 mph on a 55-yard touchdown run.
Other rookie contributions included strong performances from Will Campbell, Jared Wilson, Craig Woodson, and Elijah Ponder on both offense and defense.

title: Oddsmakers have Drake Maye as NFL MVP favorite
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Drake Maye is FanDuel's current NFL MVP frontrunner with odds at +250 following the Patriots' victory over Tampa Bay.
In the game against the Buccaneers, Maye completed 16-of-31 passes for 270 yards, two touchdowns, and one interception.
This season, Maye has a 71.7% completion rate, throwing for 2,555 yards, 19 touchdowns, and five interceptions, plus 283 rushing yards.

title: Rob Gronkowski announces that he will ‘retire as a Patriot’
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Rob Gronkowski will sign a one-day contract with the Patriots to officially retire with the team.
Gronkowski played nine seasons with New England, winning three Super Bowls before two seasons with Tampa Bay.
Gronkowski is regarded as one of the NFL's greatest tight ends, with 92 career receiving touchdowns.

title: Patriots stock watch: Here’s who stood out and struggled against the Buccaneers
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Rookies TreVeyon Henderson and Kyle Williams played key roles in Patriots' 28-23 win over the Buccaneers.
Drake Maye connected on crucial plays despite a season-low completion percentage, aiding New England's seventh consecutive victory.
Patriots showed mixed defensive performance; success in key plays but struggled against Buccaneers' Emeka Egbuka.

title: 10 takeaways from Patriots’ impressive road win over Buccaneers
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots rookies TreVeyon Henderson and Kyle Williams combined for three touchdowns in a 28-23 win over the Buccaneers.
Quarterback Drake Maye completed 16 of 31 passes for 270 yards, two touchdowns, and one interception against Tampa.
New England extended its win streak to seven games, improving its record to 8-2 for the season.

title: MBTA Transit Police officer facing drunk driving charge after allegedly crashing into pole
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: MBTA Transit Police officer Jonathan Daveiga charged with drunk driving after crashing into a pole on Oct. 19.
Daveiga, 27, pleaded not guilty and was released on personal recognizance; his next court date is Dec. 19.
State Police found Daveiga's Jeep on a curb with signs of impairment; officer placed on modified duty.

title: Allston Car Wash employees still in federal custody after ICE raid
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Nine Allston Car Wash employees with work permits detained by ICE on November 4, remain in federal custody.
ICE alleged the workers entered the U.S. illegally; detainees report mistreatment including lack of food and showers.
Local officials and activists are supporting families of detainees; Rep. Pressley and others express outrage over the raid.

title: ‘SNL’ recap: Best moments from Nikki Glaser hosting ‘Saturday Night Live’
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Nikki Glaser hosted 'Saturday Night Live' on November 8, 2025, with Sombr as the musical guest.
Glaser gained fame after a standout performance at the 2024 Tom Brady roast and hosting other major events.
Highlights included Glaser's monologue, Sombr's performances, and Pete Davidson's return to the 'Weekend Update' desk.
